trans-unit.source: If you experience problems connecting remotely to an MBean server using JMX, it may be helpful to obtain some tracing information.

seg-source.mrk: If you experience problems connecting remotely to an MBean server using JMX, it may be helpful to obtain some tracing information.

target.mrk: If you experience problems connecting remotely to an MBean server using JMX, it may be helpful to obtain some tracing information.

trans-unit.source: For details on connecting remotely to an MBean server, see <xref href="radminjmxjconsole.dita#radminjmxjconsole"></xref> and <xref href="radminjmxcode.dita#radminjmxcode"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: For details on connecting remotely to an MBean server, see <xref href="radminjmxjconsole.dita#radminjmxjconsole"></xref> and <xref href="radminjmxcode.dita#radminjmxcode"></xref>.

target.mrk: For details on connecting remotely to an MBean server, see <xref href="radminjmxjconsole.dita#radminjmxjconsole"></xref> and <xref href="radminjmxcode.dita#radminjmxcode"></xref>.

trans-unit.source: The JMX implementation in the Oracle JDK uses the <codeph>java.util.logging</codeph> API to log JMX traces. For example, in order to trace SSL connection issues, set the system property <codeph>java.util.logging.config.file</codeph> as shown in the following:

seg-source.mrk: The JMX implementation in the Oracle JDK uses the <codeph>java.util.logging</codeph> API to log JMX traces.
For example, in order to trace SSL connection issues, set the system property <codeph>java.util.logging.config.file</codeph> as shown in the following:

target.mrk: The JMX implementation in the Oracle JDK uses the <codeph>java.util.logging</codeph> API to log JMX traces.
For example, in order to trace SSL connection issues, set the system property <codeph>java.util.logging.config.file</codeph> as shown in the following:

trans-unit.source: With JConsole, a separate logging window will appear if you specify the following option when you start JConsole (see <xref href="radminjmxjconsole.dita#radminjmxjconsole"></xref>), as long as the <codeph>logging.properties</codeph> file is found:

seg-source.mrk: With JConsole, a separate logging window will appear if you specify the following option when you start JConsole (see <xref href="radminjmxjconsole.dita#radminjmxjconsole"></xref>), as long as the <codeph>logging.properties</codeph> file is found:

target.mrk: With JConsole, a separate logging window will appear if you specify the following option when you start JConsole (see <xref href="radminjmxjconsole.dita#radminjmxjconsole"></xref>), as long as the <codeph>logging.properties</codeph> file is found:

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>logging.properties</codeph> file should specify log handlers and logging levels, as in the following example:

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>logging.properties</codeph> file should specify log handlers and logging levels, as in the following example:

target.mrk: The <codeph>logging.properties</codeph> file should specify log handlers and logging levels, as in the following example:

trans-unit.source: handlers = java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler .level = INFO java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler.level=FINEST java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler.formatter=java.util.logging.SimpleFormatter // Level FINEST is suitable for diagnosing SSL-related JMX remote // connection issues. javax.management.level=FINEST javax.management.remote.level=FINEST

seg-source.mrk: handlers = java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler .level = INFO java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler.level=FINEST java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler.formatter=java.util.logging.SimpleFormatter // Level FINEST is suitable for diagnosing SSL-related JMX remote // connection issues.

target.mrk: handlers = java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler .level = INFO java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler.level=FINEST java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler.formatter=java.util.logging.SimpleFormatter // Level FINEST is suitable for diagnosing SSL-related JMX remote // connection issues.

trans-unit.source: The blog entry <xref format="html" href="https://blogs.oracle.com/jmxetc/entry/troubleshooting_connection_problems_in_jconsole" scope="external">https://blogs.oracle.com/jmxetc/entry/troubleshooting_connection_problems_in_jconsole</xref> provides additional hints and tips.
